But if it performs as Lockheed and D - Wave expect , the design could be used to supercharge even the most powerful systems , solving some science and business problems millions of times faster than can be  done today . Ray Johnson , Lockheeds chief technical officer , said his company would use the quantum computer to create and test complex radar , space and aircraft systems . It could be possible , for example , to tell instantly how the millions of lines of software running a network of satellites would react to a solar burst or a pulse from a nuclear explosion   something that can now take weeks , if ever , to determine . 	answer: negative
event: can done today starts before Ray Johnson , Lockheeds chief technical officer , said his company would use the quantum computer to create and test complex radar , space and aircraft systems story: Our digital age is all about bits , those precise ones and zeros that are the stuff of modern computer code . But a powerful new type of computer that is about to be commercially deployed by a major American military contractor is taking computing into the strange , subatomic realm of quantum mechanics . In that infinitesimal neighborhood , common sense logic no longer seems to apply . A one can be a one , or it can be a one and a zero and everything in between   all at the same time . It sounds preposterous , particularly to those familiar with the yes / no world of conventional computing . But academic researchers and scientists at companies like Microsoft , I.B.M. and Hewlett - Packard have been working to develop quantum computers . Skeptics say that D - Wave has yet to prove to outside scientists that it has solved the myriad challenges involved in quantum computation . But if it performs as Lockheed and D - Wave expect , the design could be used to supercharge even the most powerful systems , solving some science and business problems millions of times faster than can be  done today . Ray Johnson , Lockheeds chief technical officer ,  said his company would use the quantum computer to create and test complex radar , space and aircraft systems . It could be possible , for example , to tell instantly how the millions of lines of software running a network of satellites would react to a solar burst or a pulse from a nuclear explosion   something that can now take weeks , if ever , to determine . 	answer: positive
event: can done today starts after Ray Johnson , Lockheeds chief technical officer , said his company would use the quantum computer to create and test complex radar , space and aircraft systems story: Our digital age is all about bits , those precise ones and zeros that are the stuff of modern computer code . But a powerful new type of computer that is about to be commercially deployed by a major American military contractor is taking computing into the strange , subatomic realm of quantum mechanics . In that infinitesimal neighborhood , common sense logic no longer seems to apply . A one can be a one , or it can be a one and a zero and everything in between   all at the same time . It sounds preposterous , particularly to those familiar with the yes / no world of conventional computing . But academic researchers and scientists at companies like Microsoft , I.B.M. and Hewlett - Packard have been working to develop quantum computers . Skeptics say that D - Wave has yet to prove to outside scientists that it has solved the myriad challenges involved in quantum computation . But if it performs as Lockheed and D - Wave expect , the design could be used to supercharge even the most powerful systems , solving some science and business problems millions of times faster than can be  done today . Ray Johnson , Lockheeds chief technical officer ,  said his company would use the quantum computer to create and test complex radar , space and aircraft systems . It could be possible , for example , to tell instantly how the millions of lines of software running a network of satellites would react to a solar burst or a pulse from a nuclear explosion   something that can now take weeks , if ever , to determine . 	answer: negative
event: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts after President Barack Obama scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama  arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after  scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts before President Barack Obama scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama  arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after  scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative

event: President Barack Obama scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts before President Barack Obama leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after  scoring a diplomatic coup just before  leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive

Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: President Barack Obama scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts after when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after  scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu  apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative
event: President Barack Obama scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts after a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after  scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that  killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: President Barack Obama scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts before a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after  scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that  killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative
event: President Barack Obama leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts after a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before  leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that  killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: President Barack Obama leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts before a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before  leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that  killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative
event: when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts after a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu  apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that  killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts before a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu  apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that  killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative
event: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts after The apology long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan story: President Barack Obama  arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long  sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts before The apology long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan story: President Barack Obama  arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long  sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative
event: President Barack Obama scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts before The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after  scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan ,  eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: President Barack Obama scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts after The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after  scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan ,  eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative
event: President Barack Obama leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts after The apology long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before  leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long  sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive

The apology , long  sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative

The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan ,  eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive

However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . The apology , long  sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive

The apology , long  sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan ,  eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive

event: a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts before The apology long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that  killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long  sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla starts after The apology long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that  killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long  sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative

The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan ,  eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: The apology long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan starts after The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long  sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan ,  eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative
event: The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East starts after It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan ,  eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It  happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East starts before It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan ,  eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It  happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative
event: It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing starts before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It  happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One  departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing starts after Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It  happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One  departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative

The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology  included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government  dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive

event: the joint military exercises that suspended after the flotilla raid starts before Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were  suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially  said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: the joint military exercises that suspended after the flotilla raid starts after Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were  suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially  said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative
event: Turkey prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia starts before Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been  prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially  said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: positive
event: Turkey prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia starts after Israel initially said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops story: President Barack Obama arrived in refugee - flooded Jordan on Friday after scoring a diplomatic coup just before leaving Israel when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu apologized to Turkey for a 2010 commando raid that killed nine activists on a Turkish vessel in a Gaza - bound flotilla . The apology , long sought by Turkish Prime Minister Recep Erdogan , eased strained feelings between Turkey and Israel , two vital U.S. allies in the Middle East . It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . It is the first foreign trip of his second term . A statement from Netanyahu 's office said the apology included an offer of compensation . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . Turkey had been  prosecuting four Israeli soldiers in absentia and Israel initially  said the two leaders agreed to the cancellation of legal steps against the troops . Later , however , its amended statement omitted that action as well . 	answer: negative

It happened in a phone call to Erdogan during a final meeting between Obama and Netanyahu at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv minutes before Air Force One departed for Jordan to complete the president 's Middle East swing . However , there was confusion later when the Israeli government dropped a reference in its original statement to normalized relations between the countries with a return of ambassadors . There also was no word on whether the once - close nations would resume the joint military exercises that were suspended after the flotilla raid . event: settling for a bare bones app to fill the void the search giant starts after Instead of settling for a bare bones app to fill the void the search giant took things one step further story: It was a glaring hole , considering that Apple 's iPhone has built - in Notes and Reminders apps that can be powered by Siri . Keep is n't simply just a place to bank whatever random half - thoughts come to mind : Users can construct to - do lists , stash photos , and color code your notes -- all in one well - designed and easy - to - use interface . The second you log anything into your phone , it is also accessible from a PC Web browser via Google Drive . Alternatively , you can save things while working on your computer , and it will instantly appear on your phone , ready for use while on the go . The design may not be as progressive as the to - do app Swiping left or right will archive those notes you no longer need ( but do n't want to erase entirely ) . The entire experience is frictionless . Organization options are limited -- color coding is your only choice , and you ca n't re - order your notes . But that 's more a function of it being new , rather than poorly thought out . Like most things Google , expect the company to flesh out Keep over time and really turn it into our personal internet junk drawer . It 's easy to foresee the day the when users will be able to send anything from their Web browser or Maps directly to Keep . The prospect of Keep incorporating features of services such as Pinterest or Pocket , or even making it easy to catalog streaming media , could turn it into something big . That should scare Evernote . 	answer: positive
