event: Like most things Google expect the company to flesh out Keep over time and really turn it into our personal internet junk drawer starts before foresee the day the when users will be able to send anything from their Web browser or Maps directly to Keep story: Before the arrival of Keep , which Google launched this week , there was no default note - taking app for Android . It was a glaring hole , considering that Apple 's iPhone has built - in Notes and Reminders apps that can be powered by Siri . Keep is n't simply just a place to bank whatever random half - thoughts come to mind : Users can construct to - do lists , stash photos , and color code your notes -- all in one well - designed and easy - to - use interface . The second you log anything into your phone , it is also accessible from a PC Web browser via Google Drive . Swiping left or right will archive those notes you no longer need ( but do n't want to erase entirely ) . At the top of the app is a text entry field that serves as your main point of entry for all new notes . Organization options are limited -- color coding is your only choice , and you ca n't re - order your notes . It 's easy to  foresee the day the when users will be able to send anything from their Web browser or Maps directly to Keep . That should scare Evernote . Keep is not the reinvention of the wheel in any aspect -- there are a plethora of third - party apps already available for Android . But it is a well - exectuted refinement . In filling a minor , but important gap in its mobile ecosystem , Google gives the competition one less claim of superiority over Android . 	answer: positive
event: Like most things Google expect the company to flesh out Keep over time and really turn it into our personal internet junk drawer starts after foresee the day the when users will be able to send anything from their Web browser or Maps directly to Keep story: Before the arrival of Keep , which Google launched this week , there was no default note - taking app for Android . It was a glaring hole , considering that Apple 's iPhone has built - in Notes and Reminders apps that can be powered by Siri . Keep is n't simply just a place to bank whatever random half - thoughts come to mind : Users can construct to - do lists , stash photos , and color code your notes -- all in one well - designed and easy - to - use interface . The second you log anything into your phone , it is also accessible from a PC Web browser via Google Drive . Swiping left or right will archive those notes you no longer need ( but do n't want to erase entirely ) . At the top of the app is a text entry field that serves as your main point of entry for all new notes . Organization options are limited -- color coding is your only choice , and you ca n't re - order your notes . It 's easy to  foresee the day the when users will be able to send anything from their Web browser or Maps directly to Keep . That should scare Evernote . Keep is not the reinvention of the wheel in any aspect -- there are a plethora of third - party apps already available for Android . But it is a well - exectuted refinement . In filling a minor , but important gap in its mobile ecosystem , Google gives the competition one less claim of superiority over Android . 	answer: negative
event: A New York man who accused of faking his death last summer starts after who faking his death last summer story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: A New York man who accused of faking his death last summer starts before who faking his death last summer story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: A New York man who accused of faking his death last summer starts before A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday story: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: A New York man who accused of faking his death last summer starts after A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday story: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " 	answer: negative
event: A New York man who accused of faking his death last summer starts before A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: A New York man who accused of faking his death last summer starts after A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: negative
event: who faking his death last summer starts before A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday story: A New York man who was accused of  faking his death last summer  pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: who faking his death last summer starts after A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday story: A New York man who was accused of  faking his death last summer  pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: who faking his death last summer starts before A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced story: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . 	answer: positive
event: who faking his death last summer starts after A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced story: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . 	answer: negative
event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday starts before A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: positive
event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday starts after A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: negative
event: A New York man who accused of faking his death last summer starts after reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: A New York man who was  accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: A New York man who accused of faking his death last summer starts before reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: A New York man who was  accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . event: A New York man who accused of faking his death last summer starts after Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: A New York man who was  accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive

event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday starts after reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first  reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday starts before reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first  reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday starts after Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported  missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday starts before Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported  missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced starts after reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice  announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " " " 	answer: positive
event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced starts before reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice  announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " " " 	answer: negative
event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced starts after Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice  announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced starts before Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice  announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts after Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first  reported  missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts before Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first  reported  missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts before Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first  reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police  said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts after Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first  reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police  said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts before Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts after Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts before South Carolina where he pulled for speeding story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been  pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive

event: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts before Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive

event: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts before South Carolina where he pulled for speeding story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported  missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth starts after South Carolina where he pulled for speeding story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported  missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said .
