On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after South Carolina where he pulled for speeding story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police  said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been  pulled over for speeding . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " He 's accepted responsibility . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before South Carolina where he pulled for speeding story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police  said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been  pulled over for speeding . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " He 's accepted responsibility . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after South Carolina where he pulled for speeding story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities  learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been  pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before South Carolina where he pulled for speeding story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities  learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been  pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after Raymond Roth pulled story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police  said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . " He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before Raymond Roth pulled story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police  said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . " He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after e - mails she discovered story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had  discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before e - mails she discovered story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had  discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after e - mails that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies New York State Park Police said authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before e - mails that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after Raymond Roth pulled story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before Raymond Roth pulled story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana ,  showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana ,  showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after e - mails she discovered story: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had  discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before e - mails she discovered story: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had  discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts after e - mails that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that  appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding starts before e - mails that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that  appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: South Carolina where he pulled for speeding starts after Raymond Roth pulled story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive

event: South Carolina where he pulled for speeding starts after The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . " On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: South Carolina where he pulled for speeding starts before The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . " On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: South Carolina where he pulled for speeding starts after e - mails she discovered story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: South Carolina where he pulled for speeding starts before e - mails she discovered story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: negative
event: Raymond Roth pulled starts after The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana ,  showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Raymond Roth pulled starts before The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana ,  showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Raymond Roth pulled starts after e - mails she discovered story: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had  discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Raymond Roth pulled starts before e - mails she discovered story: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had  discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death starts after e - mails she discovered story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . " He 's admitted it now . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death starts before e - mails she discovered story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: negative
event: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death starts before e - mails that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana ,  showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that  appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: positive
event: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death starts after e - mails that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana ,  showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that  appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: negative
event: e - mails she discovered starts before e - mails that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: positive
event: e - mails she discovered starts after e - mails that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: negative
event: Raymond Roth pulled starts after Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was  pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth  wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . " 	answer: positive

Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . " 	answer: negative

event: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death starts after Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana ,  showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over his wife , Evana showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death starts before Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said .
