event: she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July starts before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Evana Roth told CNN in August she  thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she  uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: positive
event: she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July starts after she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Evana Roth told CNN in August she  thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she  uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: negative
event: her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July starts before Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July starts after Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July starts before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July starts after she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " 	answer: negative
event: he fired from his job in July starts before Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was  fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds ,  said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: he fired from his job in July starts after Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was  fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds ,  said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: negative
event: he fired from his job in July starts before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she  uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: he fired from his job in July starts after she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she  uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " 	answer: negative
event: Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence starts after she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds ,  said she had been unaware of the ruse before she  uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " He 's admitted it now . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence starts before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds ,  said she had been unaware of the ruse before she  uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " He 's admitted it now . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence starts before how things going story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds ,  said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " He 's admitted it now . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive

event: she uncovered the e - mail correspondence starts before how things going story: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she  uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . " On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive

Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she  uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . " On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . event: how things going starts after Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth  wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: how things going starts before Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth  wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: how things going starts after the son reported him missing story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are  going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: positive
event: how things going starts before the son reported him missing story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are  going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " " He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: negative
event: how things going starts after him missing story: Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are  going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him  missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: how things going starts before him missing story: Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are  going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him  missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing starts before the son reported him missing story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth  wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: positive
event: Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing starts after the son reported him missing story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth  wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . 	answer: negative
event: Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing starts before him missing story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth  wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him  missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing starts after him missing story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth  wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him  missing . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: the son reported him missing starts after him missing story: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him  missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: the son reported him missing starts before him missing story: Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him  missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing starts before The son 's case still pending story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth  wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still  pending , the district attorney said . " He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing starts after The son 's case still pending story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth  wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . The son 's case is still  pending , the district attorney said . " He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing starts before The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing starts after The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . " He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: the son reported him missing starts before The son 's case still pending story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " 	answer: positive
event: the son reported him missing starts after The son 's case still pending story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . " 	answer: negative
event: the son reported him missing starts before The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him missing . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: the son reported him missing starts after The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son  reported him missing . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . event: him missing starts before The son 's case still pending story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him  missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: him missing starts after The son 's case still pending story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him  missing . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: him missing starts before The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him  missing . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . 	answer: positive
event: him missing starts after The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . event: The son 's case still pending starts before The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: The son 's case still pending starts after The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said story: A New York man who was accused of faking his death last summer pleaded guilty to a conspiracy charge Thursday , Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice announced . Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said starts after Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney  said . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson ,  defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis told CNN on Thursday . He 's admitted it now . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . 	answer: positive
event: The son 's case is still pending the district attorney said starts before Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Several days into an extensive search involving multiple agencies , New York State Park Police said , authorities learned the missing man was in South Carolina , where he had been pulled over for speeding . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . event: Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , saying There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father starts after Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme story: The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth on Thursday agreed to plead guilty to the conspiracy charge in exchange for a sentence of 90 days in jail and five years ' probation , the district attorney 's office said . He also must pay restitution for the cost of the search -- $ 27,445 to the U.S. Coast Guard and $ 9,109 to the Nassau County Police Department . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . " There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest ,  saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis ,  denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . During plea negotiations , Raymond Roth asked the district attorney 's office not to give his son jail time , Davis said . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive

event: Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme starts before We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son Davis told CNN on Thursday story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis ,  denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis  told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme starts after We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son Davis told CNN on Thursday story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . Raymond Roth wanted his wife and son to collect at least $ 410,000 in life insurance benefits while he started a new life in Florida , Rice said . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . There needs to be a way for me to find out how things are going . The son 's case is still pending , the district attorney said . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis ,  denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . " We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis  told CNN on Thursday . " He 's admitted it now . He 's accepted responsibility . " Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . On the advice of both their attorneys , father and son have not been in contact since their arrests , Davis said . " He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son Davis told CNN on Thursday starts after He admitted it now story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . The day before Raymond Roth was pulled over , his wife , Evana , showed authorities e - mails she had discovered that appeared to detail a plan between him and his son to fake his death . State police arrested both men in early August on charges of insurance fraud , conspiracy and filing a false report . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July . Her attorney , Lenard Leeds , said she had been unaware of the ruse before she uncovered the e - mail correspondence . Call me Sunday night at 8 PM at the resort , " Raymond Roth wrote in an e - mail to his son the day before the son reported him missing . Jonathan Roth 's attorney , Joey Jackson , defended his client after his arrest , saying , " There was abuse here , manipulation here , coercion here " from the father . Raymond Roth 's attorney , Brian Davis , denied in August that Roth had involved his son in the scheme . We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son , " Davis  told CNN on Thursday . He 's accepted responsibility . Davis added that his client has been under treatment for bipolar disorder in recent weeks . He would like to straighten things out with ( Jonathan ) when the time comes , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: We had issues concerning the facts people had whether ( Roth ) had an agreement with his son Davis told CNN on Thursday starts before He admitted it now story: Raymond Roth , 48 , of Massapequa , New York , was first reported missing in the waters off Jones Beach late last July by his 22-year - old son , Jonathan Roth . Evana Roth told CNN in August she thought her husband devised the plan after he was fired from his job in July .
