He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday starts after the inspections directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors  returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly  linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: positive

Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors  returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly  linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: inspectors already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday starts before A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already  seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website  said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: inspectors already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday starts after A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already  seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website  said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: inspectors already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday starts before the inspections directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already  seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly  linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: inspectors already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday starts after the inspections directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already  seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly  linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it starts after the inspections directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website  said the inspections were directly  linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it starts before the inspections directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website  said the inspections were directly  linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it starts after it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website  said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it  was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: positive

Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it  was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: the inspections directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it starts before Memorial director Arseny Roginsky quoted by the Russian news website Vesti story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly  linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky ,  quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: the inspections directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it starts after Memorial director Arseny Roginsky quoted by the Russian news website Vesti story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly  linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky ,  quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: negative

event: Memorial director Arseny Roginsky quoted by the Russian news website Vesti starts after it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky ,  quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it  was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Memorial director Arseny Roginsky quoted by the Russian news website Vesti starts before it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky ,  quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it  was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: negative
event: Memorial director Arseny Roginsky quoted by the Russian news website Vesti said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " starts after it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti ,  said it  was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: positive
event: Memorial director Arseny Roginsky quoted by the Russian news website Vesti said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " starts before it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " story: Russian police and tax inspectors have raided the offices of the human rights group Memorial and other civil society groups which get foreign funding . Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky , quoted by the Russian news website Vesti ,  said it  was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: negative

Memorial is famous for documenting human rights abuses in Russia . The US embassy in Moscow has voiced concern and asked the Russian government for an explanation . A new Russian law says foreign - funded non - governmental groups ( NGOs ) linked to politics must register as " foreign agents " - a term which suggests spying . In the worst repressions of the Soviet period the label " foreign agents " was used to denounce dissidents - or simply political rivals of Joseph Stalin - and could lead to execution . Memorial says inspectors returned to its Moscow offices on Friday , having already seized 600 documents including accounts on Thursday . A statement on the Memorial website said the inspections were directly linked to the new law on NGOs and the targeted groups ' compliance with it . Memorial director Arseny Roginsky ,  quoted by the Russian news website Vesti , said it was " a complete check on everything concerned with our sources of funding " . He  insisted that the NGO law " will not change our position at all " . " We wo n't refuse foreign donations , nor will we register as a ' foreign agent ' , " he said . 	answer: positive

event: He tries to undermine his opponents with it and get the crowd -- in this case the public -- on his side starts before I can assure you that having a crowd laugh at your critic / heckler is not only effective in dominating them , it 's also very satisfying story: Barack Obama would make a great stand - up comic , not because he 's the funniest president ever but because he uses jokes the same way many of us comedians do : as a weapon . Traditionally , the ( intentionally ) funny lines by our presidents have had one thing in common : They were self - deprecating . Sure , some presidents have used jokes to take jabs at their opponents , but not to the extent of Obama . During his tenure , he has increasingly unleashed biting comedic barbs against his critics and political adversaries . These jokes are intended to do more than simply entertain you . They have an agenda . Obama 's humor is often delivered the way a comedian dealing with a heckler would do it . He  tries to undermine his opponents with it and get the crowd -- in this case the public -- on his side . I can  assure you that having a crowd laugh at your critic / heckler is not only effective in dominating them , it 's also very satisfying . 	answer: positive
event: He tries to undermine his opponents with it and get the crowd -- in this case the public -- on his side starts after I can assure you that having a crowd laugh at your critic / heckler is not only effective in dominating them , it 's also very satisfying story: Barack Obama would make a great stand - up comic , not because he 's the funniest president ever but because he uses jokes the same way many of us comedians do : as a weapon . Traditionally , the ( intentionally ) funny lines by our presidents have had one thing in common : They were self - deprecating . Sure , some presidents have used jokes to take jabs at their opponents , but not to the extent of Obama . During his tenure , he has increasingly unleashed biting comedic barbs against his critics and political adversaries . These jokes are intended to do more than simply entertain you . They have an agenda . Obama 's humor is often delivered the way a comedian dealing with a heckler would do it . He  tries to undermine his opponents with it and get the crowd -- in this case the public -- on his side . I can  assure you that having a crowd laugh at your critic / heckler is not only effective in dominating them , it 's also very satisfying . 	answer: negative
event: it killed 105 children so far about the average toll starts after The season started about a month earlier than usual sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade story: The flu season is winding down , and it has  killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season  started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " 	answer: positive
event: it killed 105 children so far about the average toll starts before The season started about a month earlier than usual sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade story: The flu season is winding down , and it has  killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season  started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " 	answer: negative
event: The season started about a month earlier than usual sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade starts before It ended being very hard on the elderly story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . It  ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive
event: The season started about a month earlier than usual sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade starts after It ended being very hard on the elderly story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . It  ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative
event: The season started about a month earlier than usual sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade starts before according story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season  started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall ,  according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive
event: The season started about a month earlier than usual sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade starts after according story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative
event: sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade starts before It ended being very hard on the elderly story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual ,  sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It  ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " 	answer: positive
event: sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade starts after It ended being very hard on the elderly story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual ,  sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It  ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " 	answer: negative
event: sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade starts before according story: The season started about a month earlier than usual ,  sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive
event: sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade starts after according story: The season started about a month earlier than usual ,  sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative
event: It ended being very hard on the elderly starts before according story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . It  ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall ,  according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive

event: It ended being very hard on the elderly starts after Six of the pediatric deaths reported in the last week story: The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It  ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were  reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive

event: It ended being very hard on the elderly starts before Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung Friday story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It  ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more ,  said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive

In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative

event: Six of the pediatric deaths reported in the last week starts before Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung Friday story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . Six of the pediatric deaths were  reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more ,  said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive

event: Six of the pediatric deaths reported in the last week starts before Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive

event: said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung starts before the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention .  said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung  said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive
event: said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung starts after the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention .  said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung  said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative
event: 348 children died starts before The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray story: The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children  died . The CDC  recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive

" We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative
event: the children who died starts before All but four of the children who died vaccinated story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who  died were old enough to be  vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive
event: the children who died starts after All but four of the children who died vaccinated story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who  died were old enough to be  vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative
event: the children who died starts before All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated CDC officials said story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive
event: the children who died starts after All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated CDC officials said story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative
event: All but four of the children who died vaccinated starts before All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated CDC officials said story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be  vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials  said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive
event: All but four of the children who died vaccinated starts after All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated CDC officials said story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be  vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials  said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative
event: the children who died starts before considered effective in children though it did n't work very well in older people story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . All but four of the children who  died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was  considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive

All but four of the children who  died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be  vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was  considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive

It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials  said . This year 's vaccine was  considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . event: This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual starts before This flu season peaked by the end of year story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season  started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and  peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive
event: This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual starts after This flu season peaked by the end of year story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . One exception was the swine flu pandemic of 2009 - 2010 , when 348 children died . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season  started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and  peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been dropping off throughout the country . We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: negative
event: This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual starts before Since then flu reports dropping throughout the country story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season  started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . Since then , flu reports have been  dropping off throughout the country . " We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung said . 	answer: positive
event: This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual starts after Since then flu reports dropping throughout the country story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . event: Since then flu reports dropping throughout the country starts before We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season Jhung said story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . It ended up being very hard on the elderly , but was moderately severe overall , according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . Roughly 100 children die in an average flu season . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . event: appear to be getting close to the end of flu season starts before We appear to be getting close to the end of flu season Jhung said story: The flu season is winding down , and it has killed 105 children so far - about the average toll . The season started about a month earlier than usual , sparking concerns it might turn into the worst in a decade . Six of the pediatric deaths were reported in the last week , and it 's possible there will be more , said the CDC 's Dr. Michael Jhung said Friday . The CDC recommends that all children ages 6 months and older be vaccinated against flu each season , though only about half get a flu shot or nasal spray . All but four of the children who died were old enough to be vaccinated , but 90 percent of them did not get vaccinated , CDC officials said . This year 's vaccine was considered effective in children , though it did n't work very well in older people . And the dominant flu strain early in the season was one that tends to cause more severe illness . The government only does a national flu death count for children . But it does track hospitalization rates for people 65 and older , and those statistics have been grim . In that group , 177 out of every 100,000 were hospitalized with flu - related illness in the past several months . That 's more than 2 1/2 times higher than any other recent season . This flu season started in early December , a month earlier than usual , and peaked by the end of year . " We  appear to be getting close to the end of flu season , " Jhung  said . 	answer: positive
