event: The deal brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel starts after he accepted the apology in the name of the Turkish people story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was  brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had  accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " starts after he accepted the apology in the name of the Turkish people story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office  said he had  accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " starts before he accepted the apology in the name of the Turkish people story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office  said he had  accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " starts after In the past he always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office  said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " starts before In the past he always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office  said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: he accepted the apology in the name of the Turkish people starts after In the past he always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had  accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: he accepted the apology in the name of the Turkish people starts before In the past he always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had  accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families starts before Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families starts after Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families starts before when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families starts after when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families starts before it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families starts after it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always  given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after activists attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: Nine people killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before activists attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were  killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . event: when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: when it boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was  boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts before its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative

Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: it trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade starts after activists attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while  trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning starts before The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive

In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . event: The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning starts after its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning starts before its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them .
