event: The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning starts after activists attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning starts before activists attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts after its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts before its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts after activists attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts before activists attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts after activists attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts before activists attacked them story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning starts after the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning starts before the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning starts after they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning starts before they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government  admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts after the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts before the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts after they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The Israeli government insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts before they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but  insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts after the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts before the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts after they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them starts before they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos  used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: activists attacked them starts before The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists  said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: activists attacked them starts after The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists  said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: activists attacked them starts after they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: activists attacked them starts before they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had  attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time starts after the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists  said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time starts before the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists  said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time starts after they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists  said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time starts before they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists  said the troops had opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time starts after they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time starts before they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they  boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time starts after The incident provoked an international outcry story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists  said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident  provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time starts before The incident provoked an international outcry story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists  said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident  provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . event: the troops opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time starts before The incident provoked an international outcry story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident  provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive

The activists said the troops had  opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and  led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive

Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . event: The incident led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel starts after Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and  led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama  revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative
event: The incident led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel starts before Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan just spoken by telephone story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and  led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just  spoken by telephone . 	answer: positive
event: The incident led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel starts after Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan just spoken by telephone story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and  led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon , Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just  spoken by telephone . 	answer: negative

Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The Israeli government admitted mistakes were made in intelligence - gathering and planning , but insisted its commandos used lethal force because activists had attacked them . The activists said the troops had opened fire as soon as they boarded the vessel , which was in international waters at the time . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . event: Before departing for Jordan on Friday afternoon Mr Obama revealed that Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan had just spoken by telephone starts before Mr Netanyahu and Mr Erdogan just spoken by telephone story: Israel 's prime minister has apologised to Turkey for " any errors that could have led to loss of life " during the 2010 commando raid on an aid flotilla that tried to breach the Gaza blockade . Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to compensate the families of the nine activists who were killed . Mr Netanyahu had previously only expressed regret for the deaths . The deal was brokered by US President Barack Obama during a visit to Israel . Mr Erdogan 's office said he had accepted the apology , " in the name of the Turkish people " . In the past , he has always given two conditions for restoring bilateral relations with Israel - an apology and compensation for victims ' families . Nine people were killed on board the Turkish aid ship , Mavi Marmara , when it was boarded by Israeli commandos while trying to transport aid supplies to Gaza in May 2010 in spite of an Israeli naval blockade . The incident provoked an international outcry and led to a major deterioration in relations between Turkey and Israel . event: China 's state leadership transition taken place this month against an ominous backdrop starts after More than 16,000 dead pigs found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai story: China 's state leadership transition has  taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been  found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: China 's state leadership transition taken place this month against an ominous backdrop starts before More than 16,000 dead pigs found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai story: China 's state leadership transition has  taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . event: China 's state leadership transition taken place this month against an ominous backdrop starts after More than 16,000 dead pigs floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai story: China 's state leadership transition has  taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found  floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . 	answer: positive

More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found  floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high .
