More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Last month , after deadly air pollution  hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " 	answer: positive
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts before deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Last month , after deadly air pollution  hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " 	answer: negative
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts after Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister ,  said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " 	answer: positive
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts before Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister ,  said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " 	answer: negative
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts after byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister ,  said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts before byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister ,  said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: the air pollution made him " quite upset " starts after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had  made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution  hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: the air pollution made him " quite upset " starts before deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had  made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution  hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: the air pollution made him " quite upset " starts after Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . " " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: the air pollution made him " quite upset " starts before Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . " " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and  vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts before deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and  vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts after Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and  vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts before Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and  vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts after byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and  vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " " 	answer: positive
event: Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up starts before byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and  vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " " 	answer: negative
event: deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China starts before Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Last month , after deadly air pollution  hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China starts after Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Last month , after deadly air pollution  hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China starts before byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Last month , after deadly air pollution  hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " 	answer: positive
event: deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China starts after byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Last month , after deadly air pollution  hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " 	answer: negative
event: Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years starts before byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years starts after byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China starts after resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China starts before resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years starts after resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years .  resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . 	answer: positive
event: Last month after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years starts before resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials  led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years .  resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . 	answer: negative
event: byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years starts after resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years starts before resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister ,  put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: And as with the oil companies the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates starts before the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals ,  saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: And as with the oil companies the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates starts after the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies , pushed back hard against the proposals ,  saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: In 2011 during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies pushed back hard against the proposals saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts before the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: In 2011 during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies pushed back hard against the proposals saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts after the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: In 2011 during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies pushed back hard against the proposals saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts before On Feb. 28 Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies ,  pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank  released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: In 2011 during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies pushed back hard against the proposals saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts after On Feb. 28 Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . In 2011 , during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards , the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies ,  pushed back hard against the proposals , saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank  released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: In 2011 during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies pushed back hard against the proposals saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts before an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note  saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: In 2011 during a round of discussions over stricter emissions standards the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies pushed back hard against the proposals saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts after an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note  saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts before On Feb. 28 Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts after On Feb. 28 Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . Fu Ying , the spokeswoman for the National People 's Congress , said she checked for smog every morning after opening her curtains and kept at home face masks for her daughter and herself . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: negative
event: the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts before an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note  saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " 	answer: positive
event: the China Electricity Council , which represents the companies saying that the costs of upgrading the plants would be too high starts after an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . More than 16,000 dead pigs have been found floating in rivers that provide drinking water to Shanghai . A haze akin to volcanic fumes cloaked the capital , causing convulsive coughing and obscuring the portrait of Mao Zedong on the gate to the Forbidden City . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . State - owned power companies have been similarly resistant . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note  saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " 	answer: negative
event: On Feb. 28 Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade starts before an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank  released an analysts ' note  saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade . " China 's air pollution will become a lot worse from the already unbearable level , " the analysts said , calling for drastic policy changes and " a strong government will to overcome the opposition from interest groups . " The report estimated that the number of passenger cars in China was on track to hit 400 million by 2030 , up from 90 million now . 	answer: positive
event: On Feb. 28 Deutsche Bank released an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade starts after an analysts ' note saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade story: China 's state leadership transition has taken place this month against an ominous backdrop . So severe are China 's environmental woes , especially the noxious air , that top government officials have been forced to openly acknowledge them . Li Keqiang , the new prime minister , said the air pollution had made him " quite upset " and vowed to " show even greater resolve and make more vigorous efforts " to clean it up . Last month , after deadly air pollution hit record levels in northern China , officials led byWen Jiabao , then the prime minister , put forward strict new fuel standards that the oil companies had blocked for years . But there are doubts about whether the oil companies will comply , especially since oil officials resisted a similar government order for higher - grade fuel four years ago . The companies regularly ignore government orders to upgrade coal - burning electricity plants , according to ministry data . And as with the oil companies , the power companies exert an outsize influence over environmental policy debates . On Feb. 28 , Deutsche Bank  released an analysts ' note  saying that China 's current economic policies would result in an enormous surge in coal consumption and automobile sales over the next decade .
