event: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home starts before As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes a doorman marched toward her with purpose story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte  slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home starts after As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes a doorman marched toward her with purpose story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte  slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: negative
event: Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes starts after the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state cast their votes story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive

Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " 	answer: positive

event: the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state cast their votes starts before As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes a doorman marched toward her with purpose story: Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive

Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . event: the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state cast their votes starts before The desks he sternly told her were for senators only story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state cast their votes starts after The desks he sternly told her were for senators only story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " There still just are n't that many of us . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: negative
event: The desks he sternly told her were for senators only starts after Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , begun story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly  told her , were for senators only . " " There still just are n't that many of us . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . " " " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: positive
event: The desks he sternly told her were for senators only starts before Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , begun story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly  told her , were for senators only . " " There still just are n't that many of us . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . " " " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: negative
event: Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , begun starts before The desk thing really stuck with me story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . The desk thing really  stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " " " " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , begun starts after The desk thing really stuck with me story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . The desk thing really  stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " " " " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , begun starts before The desk thing really stuck with me Ms. Ayotte said story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte  said . There still just are n't that many of us . " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , begun starts after The desk thing really stuck with me Ms. Ayotte said story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte  said . There still just are n't that many of us . " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: negative
event: The desk thing really stuck with me starts before The desk thing really stuck with me Ms. Ayotte said story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . The desk thing really  stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte  said . " There still just are n't that many of us . " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: The desk thing really stuck with me starts after The desk thing really stuck with me Ms. Ayotte said story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . The desk thing really  stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte  said . " There still just are n't that many of us . " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: negative
event: Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours starts before But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high women morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " " " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have  morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours starts after But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high women morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " " " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have  morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: negative
event: the first woman in the United States Senate sworn for a mere 24 hours starts before But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high women morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " There still just are n't that many of us . " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have  morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . 	answer: positive
event: the first woman in the United States Senate sworn for a mere 24 hours starts after But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high women morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " There still just are n't that many of us . " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have  morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . 	answer: negative
event: the Senate Appropriations Committee which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government starts after the Senate Appropriations Committee which long particularly dominated by men story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: the Senate Appropriations Committee which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government starts before the Senate Appropriations Committee which long particularly dominated by men story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: the Senate Appropriations Committee which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government starts before Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is  charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: positive
event: the Senate Appropriations Committee which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government starts after Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is  charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: negative

Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which  dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . event: the Senate Appropriations Committee which long particularly dominated by men starts before Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: the Senate Appropriations Committee which long particularly dominated by men starts after Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: the Senate Appropriations Committee which long particularly dominated by men starts before Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with  shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " " " " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . 	answer: positive
event: the Senate Appropriations Committee which long particularly dominated by men starts after Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with  shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " " " " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . 	answer: negative
event: Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill starts after farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill starts before farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: negative
event: Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill starts after farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . " There still just are n't that many of us . " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation  led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " " 	answer: positive

event: the biggest bills pass the Senate last year starts after farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " There still just are n't that many of us . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to  pass the Senate last year was farm legislation  led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " " 	answer: positive

event: the biggest bills pass the Senate last year starts before Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " " There still just are n't that many of us . One of the biggest bills to  pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: the biggest bills pass the Senate last year starts after Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . event: farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee starts before Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " " There still just are n't that many of us . " A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation  led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee starts after Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " " There still just are n't that many of us . " A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation  led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee starts before Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee starts after Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill starts before We growing in number story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " We are  growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill starts after We growing in number story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " We are  growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: negative
event: Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill starts before We are growing in number said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . There still just are n't that many of us . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill starts after We are growing in number said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men .
