event: We growing in number starts before We are growing in number said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . " " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: We growing in number starts after We are growing in number said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . " " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: We growing in number starts before But more importantly we growing in our power story: Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are  growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: positive
event: We growing in number starts after But more importantly we growing in our power story: Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are  growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: negative
event: We are growing in number said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota starts after But more importantly we growing in our power story: The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " " There still just are n't that many of us . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " 	answer: positive
event: We are growing in number said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota starts before But more importantly we growing in our power story: The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " " There still just are n't that many of us . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " 	answer: negative
event: But more importantly we growing in our power starts after When I first started just six years ago story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . " " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are  growing in our power . While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: But more importantly we growing in our power starts before When I first started just six years ago story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . " " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are  growing in our power . While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: But more importantly we growing in our power starts after a woman managing a bill story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " " But more importantly , we are  growing in our power . " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: But more importantly we growing in our power starts before a woman managing a bill story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " " But more importantly , we are  growing in our power . " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: negative
event: When I first started just six years ago starts before have a woman managing a bill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first  started just six years ago , it was unusual to  have a woman managing a bill . Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: When I first started just six years ago starts after have a woman managing a bill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first  started just six years ago , it was unusual to  have a woman managing a bill . Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: negative
event: When I first started just six years ago starts after a woman managing a bill story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " " When I first  started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman  managing a bill . " " " " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: When I first started just six years ago starts before a woman managing a bill story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " " When I first  started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman  managing a bill . " " " " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: have a woman managing a bill starts after a woman managing a bill story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . " " One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to  have a woman  managing a bill . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive

event: When I first started just six years ago starts before the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women  hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: When I first started just six years ago starts after the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . There still just are n't that many of us . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . event: a woman managing a bill starts before the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman  managing a bill . " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: positive

event: the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill starts before I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . event: I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio starts after it having a positive impact on the Senate story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . " " There still just are n't that many of us . " For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " So I think it 's going to have , and is  having , a positive impact on the Senate . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate starts after While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress women begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " " So I  think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive

event: So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate starts after women forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . " " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . 	answer: positive
event: So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate starts before women forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . " " " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . 	answer: negative
event: it having a positive impact on the Senate starts after While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress women begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties story: Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " " This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive

" In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . event: it having a positive impact on the Senate starts before women crack at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . " " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . event: it having a positive impact on the Senate starts after women forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . So I think it 's going to have , and is  having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive
event: it having a positive impact on the Senate starts before women forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties story: As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . So I think it 's going to have , and is  having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. event: While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress women begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties starts before women crack at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " " " " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have  begun to  crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: positive

event: women crack at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties starts after women forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to  crack away at the gridlock by  forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: positive

Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine ,  led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . event: women crack at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties starts after Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " " There still just are n't that many of us . " In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to  crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: positive

event: women crack at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties starts after allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . 	answer: positive

Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . 	answer: negative

" But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " Just as important , even male senators say , is the potential the women hold for changing the tenor of the Senate and pushing for compromise in the highly partisan atmosphere on Capitol Hill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " 	answer: negative
event: women forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties starts after Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . " There still just are n't that many of us . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine ,  led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive
event: women forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties starts before Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . " There still just are n't that many of us . But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine ,  led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: negative
event: Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military starts before This year all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . Ms. Ayotte 's induction that January day in 2011 into the most rarefied ranks of the nation 's political class , female senators , had begun . " The desk thing really stuck with me , " Ms. Ayotte said . " For the first time there is a woman - Senator Barbara A. Mikulski , a Maryland Democrat - in charge of the Senate Appropriations Committee , which dispenses billions of dollars annually throughout the government and has long been particularly dominated by men . Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill . One of the biggest bills to pass the Senate last year was farm legislation led by Senator Debbie Stabenow , a Michigan Democrat who presides over the agriculture committee . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . But more importantly , we are growing in our power . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " While partisan division is the central characteristic of the modern Congress , women have begun to crack away at the gridlock by forming coalitions that have surprised leaders of both parties . 	answer: positive
event: Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military starts after This year all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . event: Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military starts before This year all four of the female Senate Republicans voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had lapsed during the last Congress story: An hour before her colleagues gathered for their first vote of a new Congress , Senator Kelly Ayotte slipped into an empty Senate chamber to savor the grandeur of her legislative home . As Ms. Ayotte , a freshman Republican from New Hampshire , sat down at the wooden desk where generations of lawmakers from her state had cast their votes , a doorman marched toward her with purpose . The desks , he sternly told her , were for senators only . In the 90 years since Rebecca Felton of Georgia became the first woman in the United States Senate - sworn in for a mere 24 hours - women remain an anomaly in the upper chamber . A record nine women now lead committees , including some of the most powerful ones . Senator Barbara Boxer , the California Democrat who is chairwoman of the Environment and Public Works Committee , shepherded the highway bill . We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . When I first started just six years ago , it was unusual to have a woman managing a bill . " " So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine ,  led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 , allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . 	answer: positive

" " But with 20 female senators now in office , an all - time high , women have morphed from the curiosity they were for much of the 20th century into an important new force on key committees and legislation . " We are growing in number , " said Senator Amy Klobuchar , Democrat of Minnesota . " I do n't want to generalize , because this is n't true of all of them , but they tend to be interested in finding common ground , " said Senator Rob Portman , Republican of Ohio . So I think it 's going to have , and is having , a positive impact on the Senate . " Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand , Democrat of New York , and Senator Susan Collins , Republican of Maine , led the repeal in the Senate of " do n't ask , do n't tell " in 2010 ,  allowing gay men and women to serve openly in the military . This year , all four of the female Senate Republicans split with their party and voted with Senate Democrats to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act , which had  lapsed during the last Congress . 	answer: positive

Senator Patty Murray , a Washington Democrat , is the first chairwoman of the Budget Committee and is charged with shaping the Democratic strategy in the fiscal battle dominating Capitol Hill .
