Mr. Sarkozy has  denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative
event: he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign starts before alleged by her former butler story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he  abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as  alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: positive
event: he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign starts after alleged by her former butler story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he  abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as  alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative
event: Mr. Sarkozy denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler starts before alleged by her former butler story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has  denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as  alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: positive
event: Mr. Sarkozy denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler starts after alleged by her former butler story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has  denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as  alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative
event: Mr. Sarkozy denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler starts before Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has  denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog ,  called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: positive
event: Mr. Sarkozy denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler starts after Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has  denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog ,  called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative
event: Mr. Sarkozy denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler starts before the judge 's decision which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has  denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which  indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: positive
event: Mr. Sarkozy denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler starts after the judge 's decision which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has  denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which  indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative
event: Mr. Sarkozy denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler starts before the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has  denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge  believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: positive
event: Mr. Sarkozy denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler starts after the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has  denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge  believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative

Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as  alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog ,  called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: positive

Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as  alleged by her former butler . event: alleged by her former butler starts before the judge 's decision which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as  alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which  indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as  alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as  alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge  believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . event: the judge 's decision which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust starts after the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which  indicates that the judge  believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: positive
event: the judge 's decision which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust starts before the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which  indicates that the judge  believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative

Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . " The lawyer  said he would appeal . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog ,  called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer  said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative
event: the judge 's decision which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust starts before The lawyer said he would appeal story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which  indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer  said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: positive
event: the judge 's decision which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust starts after The lawyer said he would appeal story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which  indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer  said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative

Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . event: The lawyer said he would appeal starts before Mr. Sarkozy who lost his re - election bid last May story: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was informed Thursday that he would face a formal investigation into whether he abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt , 90 , the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France 's richest woman , to get funds for his 2007 presidential campaign . Mr. Sarkozy has denied accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt , either personally or through his party treasurer at the time , Eric Woerth , as alleged by her former butler . Mr. Sarkozy 's lawyer , Thierry Herzog , called the judge 's decision , which indicates that the judge believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a crime , " incoherent " and " unjust . " The lawyer  said he would appeal . The ruling does not necessarily mean that Mr. Sarkozy , who  lost his re - election bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution , will stand trial . 	answer: negative
